title: Ticket #3748: Possibly make DAGMan parsing more permissive
description:
In a meeting today, Miron suggested making DAGMan parsing more permissive, specifically, making a unrecognized keyword a warning rather than a fatal error. (The motivation for this is that we want to add some new keywords to the DAG for Pegasus information, and Pegasus has to only do that if the version of DAGMan is correct.)

My concern about this is what happens if someone, say, misspells a keyword, rather than the DAG having an entirely new keyword that's not recognized. We need to do a bit of thinking before even deciding to implement this...
creator: wenger
